intro: Centaurea indica, commonly known as the Indian knapweed, is a flowering plant native to regions of Asia, including India and China. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring slender stems and a basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces bright yellow to red flowers in composite flower heads, which are composed of numerous small florets. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn. Centaurea indica is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
